channel.title: Telemetry on The Sovereign Library
channel.description: Recent content in Telemetry on The Sovereign Library

item.title: Catalytic Crisis: Digital Farming + Frozen Car + Funds
item.description:
Catalytic Crisis: Digital Farming + Frozen Car + Funds

Summary: Concurrent failures: Digital Farming market-failed; Frozen Car incident; fund depletion pre-salary. Lesson: systemic failure demands systemic response; Survivor stockpiling worked.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batch 1

Notes

  • Keep this as a “card” unless you’re expanding with raw excerpts.
  • When expanding, add 1–3 concrete examples and link back to the relevant protocol.

item.title: Stress Test Philosophy & After-Action Review (AAR)
item.description:
Stress Test Philosophy & After-Action Review (AAR)

Summary: Formalize stress events as diagnostic procedures. Evaluate mechanically (‘what threshold was exceeded?’). Convert self-doubt into telemetry.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1–2

Notes

  • Keep this as a “card” unless you’re expanding with raw excerpts.
  • When expanding, add 1–3 concrete examples and link back to the relevant protocol.

item.title: Builder / Survivor Duality (Core Machinery)
item.description:
Builder / Survivor Duality (Core Machinery)

Summary: Two-mode operating system: Builder designs and deploys; Survivor runs 24/7 threat detection and can trigger lockout/freeze. Goal is not to kill either mode, but to become the System Admin who decides whose turn it is to drive.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1–6 (Builder/Survivor model)

Notes

  • Keep this as a “card” unless you’re expanding with raw excerpts.
  • When expanding, add 1–3 concrete examples and link back to the relevant protocol.

item.title: Somatic Telemetry: Tremor as Lockout Signal
item.description:
Somatic Telemetry: Tremor as Lockout Signal

Summary: Tremor/tightness is treated as firmware telemetry: the Survivor’s neuro-physiological lockout marker. Not fear to be argued with, but a signal to be handled with protocol.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1, 3, 4

Notes
